title: Calories in 2 Cups of Milk
meta_description: Discover calories in 2 milk (assuming cups of whole milk), including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Whole milk (3.25% fat), 1 cup â‰ˆ 244 g or 240 ml; no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by milk type (whole, skim, etc.), brand, fat content, and fortification. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: Two cups of whole milk provide ~298 kcal and ~16 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 2 cups of whole milk?
faqs.a: Approximately 298 kcal for two cups of whole milk.

faqs.q: What is the protein in 2 milk servings?
faqs.a: About 16 g protein from two cups of whole milk.

faqs.q: Does milk have fiber or low carbs?
faqs.a: Milk has 0 g fiber and ~24 g carbs (mostly sugars) in two cups.

faqs.q: How does fat content affect calories in milk?
faqs.a: Whole milk has more fat (16 g total) and calories than skim (0.4 g fat, fewer kcal).

faqs.q: Are these values for pasteurized milk?
faqs.a: Yes, standard values assume pasteurized cow's milk; plant-based alternatives differ.
